transitioncancel.name: transitioncancel_event
transitioncancel.summary: The transitioncancel event is fired when a CSS transition is canceled.
transitioncancel.title: Document: transitioncancel event

transitioncancel.name: transitioncancel_event
transitioncancel.summary: The transitioncancel event is fired when a CSS transition is canceled.
transitioncancel.title: HTMLElement: transitioncancel event

transitioncancel.name: transitioncancel_event
transitioncancel.summary: The transitioncancel event is fired when a CSS transition is canceled.
transitioncancel.title: Window: transitioncancel event

transitionend.name: transitionend_event
transitionend.summary: The transitionend event is fired when a CSS transition has completed. In the case where a transition is removed before completion, such as if the transition-property is removed or display is set to none, then the event will not be generated.
transitionend.title: Document: transitionend event

transitionend.name: transitionend_event
transitionend.summary: The transitionend event is fired when a CSS transition has completed. In the case where a transition is removed before completion, such as if the transition-property is removed or display is set to none, then the event will not be generated.
transitionend.title: HTMLElement: transitionend event

transitionend.name: transitionend_event
transitionend.summary: The transitionend event is fired when a CSS transition has completed. In the case where a transition is removed before completion, such as if the transition-property is removed or display is set to none, then the event will not be generated.
transitionend.title: Window: transitionend event

transitionrun.name: transitionrun_event
transitionrun.summary: The transitionrun event is fired when a CSS transition is first created, i.e. before any transition-delay has begun.
transitionrun.title: Document: transitionrun event

transitionrun.name: transitionrun_event
transitionrun.summary: The transitionrun event is fired when a CSS transition is first created, i.e. before any transition-delay has begun.
transitionrun.title: HTMLElement: transitionrun event

transitionrun.name: transitionrun_event
transitionrun.summary: The transitionrun event is fired when a CSS transition is first created, i.e. before any transition-delay has begun.
transitionrun.title: Window: transitionrun event

transitionstart.name: transitionstart_event
transitionstart.summary: The transitionstart event is fired when a CSS transition has actually started, i.e., after any transition-delay has ended.
transitionstart.title: Document: transitionstart event

transitionstart.name: transitionstart_event
transitionstart.summary: The transitionstart event is fired when a CSS transition has actually started, i.e., after any transition-delay has ended.
transitionstart.title: HTMLElement: transitionstart event

transitionstart.name: transitionstart_event
transitionstart.summary: The transitionstart event is fired when a CSS transition has actually started, i.e., after any transition-delay has ended.
transitionstart.title: Window: transitionstart event

dom-globaleventhandlers-ontransitioncanc.name: ontransitioncancel
dom-globaleventhandlers-ontransitioncanc.summary: The ontransitioncancel property of the GlobalEventHandlers mixin is an EventHandler that processes transitioncancel events.

safari.notes: The event handler is exposed but will not actually be called unless both the "Web Animations" and "CSS Animations via Web Animations" preferences are enabled.

safari_ios.notes: The event handler is exposed but will not actually be called unless both the "Web Animations" and "CSS Animations via Web Animations" preferences are enabled.

dom-globaleventhandlers-ontransitioncanc.title: GlobalEventHandlers.ontransitioncancel

dom-globaleventhandlers-ontransitionend.name: ontransitionend
dom-globaleventhandlers-ontransitionend.summary: The ontransitionend property of the GlobalEventHandlers mixin is an EventHandler that processes transitionend events.
dom-globaleventhandlers-ontransitionend.title: GlobalEventHandlers.ontransitionend

dom-transitionevent-transitionevent.name: TransitionEvent
dom-transitionevent-transitionevent.summary: The TransitionEvent() constructor returns a newly created TransitionEvent, representing an event in relation with an transition.
dom-transitionevent-transitionevent.title: TransitionEvent()

Events-TransitionEvent-propertyName.name: animationName
Events-TransitionEvent-propertyName.summary: The TransitionEvent.transitionName read-only property is a DOMString containing the name of the CSS property associated with the transition.
Events-TransitionEvent-propertyName.title: TransitionEvent.transitionName

Events-TransitionEvent-elapsedTime.name: elapsedTime
Events-TransitionEvent-elapsedTime.summary: The TransitionEvent.elapsedTime read-only property is a float giving the amount of time the animation has been running, in seconds, when this event fired. This value is not affected by the transition-delay property.
Events-TransitionEvent-elapsedTime.title: TransitionEvent.elapsedTime

Events-TransitionEvent-pseudoElement.name: pseudoElement
Events-TransitionEvent-pseudoElement.summary: The TransitionEvent.pseudoElement read-only property is a DOMString, starting with '::', containing the name of the pseudo-element the animation runs on. If the transition doesn't run on a pseudo-element but on the element, an empty string: ''.
Events-TransitionEvent-pseudoElement.title: TransitionEvent.pseudoElement

interface-transitionevent.name: TransitionEvent
interface-transitionevent.summary: The TransitionEvent interface represents events providing information related to transitions.
interface-transitionevent.title: TransitionEvent

transition-delay-property.name: transition-delay
transition-delay-property.summary: The transition-delay CSS property specifies the duration to wait before starting a property's transition effect when its value changes.
transition-delay-property.title: transition-delay

transition-duration-property.name: transition-duration
transition-duration-property.summary: The transition-duration CSS property sets the length of time a transition animation should take to complete. By default, the value is 0s, meaning that no animation will occur.
transition-duration-property.title: transition-duration

transition-property-property.name: transition-property
transition-property-property.summary: The transition-property CSS property sets the CSS properties to which a transition effect should be applied.
transition-property-property.title: transition-property

transition-timing-function-property.name: transition-timing-function
transition-timing-function-property.summary: The transition-timing-function CSS property sets how intermediate values are calculated for CSS properties being affected by a transition effect.
transition-timing-function-property.title: transition-timing-function

transition-shorthand-property.name: transition
transition-shorthand-property.summary: The transition CSS property is a shorthand property for transition-property, transition-duration, transition-timing-function, and transition-delay.

notes: Before Firefox 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).

Before Firefox 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).

Before Firefox 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).
Before Firefox 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).

Before Firefox 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).

Before Firefox 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).

transition-shorthand-property.title: transition
